Name: Adventures in Neverland: The Grinning Reaper
Description:
A booster (story deck) to change up your game!

This is the Kickstarter exclusive cooperative story "The Grinning Reaper."

Besides a brand new story, every booster will include new items, special locations, encounters, and tasks!
Families: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Peter Pan

Name: Primordial: Creatures of Pandemonium
Description:
Mages, the land of Cathaira needs your help!

The last Celestial War with the Titans of Yarre` has left the landscape changed. Entropic Energy spreads at an unprecedented rate and the Creatures are becoming volatile and unpredictable as their environment shifts. They are vital to the health of the continent and must be preserved!

Each of you are masters of a Sanctuary, which Entropic Energy cannot easily penetrate. Your distinct prowess and your historical harmony with the land of Cathaira means that only you can Tame these Creatures! Can you manage to offer them protection, and return the presence of Entropic Energy to normal levels?

Honor is to be had, and each of you has the opportunity to be held in the highest regard by mastering the use of Energy, advancing in knowledge, and Taming these Creatures who need your help!

Primordial: Creatures of Pandemonium is a mid-weight, euro resource management game that is played over rounds. During the game, Mages will traverse the landscape, tame mythical creatures, learn skills, become more proficient in Energy use, and manage a Sanctuary to earn more honor than other Mages.

Primary mechanisms of the game include resource management, tableau building, skill-tree progression, and area movement. Additionally, the game features a unique communal bag building element!

-description from designer

Name: お花見！場所取りバトル (Ohanami! Bashotori Battle)
StoryTime: Animal Tales
Description:
Story Time (á€•á€¯á€¶á€•á€¼á€±á€¬á€™á€šá€º) is a board game for people who love games and storytelling. Players of all ages can unleash their imaginations using our carefully illustrated abstract game cards featuring various animal tales.

In Story Time, you will work in teams and try to relay correct information to your partner(s) through storytelling using carefully illustrated abstract art cards. However, your opponents will be trying to disrupt your team so you have to think carefully not to fall for their tricks. Each team takes turns storytelling and disrupting and will compete to see who crosses the finishing line first.

Name: トゥルース・アントゥルース (Truth Untruths)
Boutwood: Cooperative Boss Battler
Description:
Boutwood is a cooperative boss battler for 1-4 players. Take on the role of various animal characters with different playstyles. Coordinate your actions, defend the forest core and defeat the attacking boss as a team.

There are currently 6 playable animal Survivors and 1 Boss-AI.

Survivors:

     Bear wants to be in the middle of the fight, getting stronger as he takes damage.
     Frog plans his actions in advance, placing deadly poison around the board.
     Crow moves quickly, giving her allies the opportunity to attack or helps them escape from danger.
     Squirrel shoots his acorns from afar, attacking from a safe position before running in to get his acorns back.
     Deer and her bird familiar coordinate together in order to attack monsters and help their allies.
     Fox jumps into fights to chain her attacks, just to get out of danger in the right moment.


Boss:

     The Spider Queen traps her victims in deadly webs and sends her spiderlings to attack the forest core.


—description from the designer

Name: Bestiary of Sigillum: Collector's Edition
Description:
Bestiary of Sigillum: Collector's Edition is an updated & extended version of Bestiary of Sigillum.

The following changes were made:
1. Included some changes to the balance
2. Updated box design and illustrations, added some new illustrations
3. Systematized character info and made it more clear
4. Added plastic organizer
5. Restructured rules and made them more understandable
6. Simplified game terminology
7. Updated components

The game has neither random events, nor hidden information, which makes it a great battle of wits, which couples greatly with impressive replayability, strategic depth and room for all kinds of tactical decisions.

In Bestiary of Sigillum you take on the role of summoners in the Kingdom of Two Castles. To play the game, you choose and summon your force of otherworldly heroes. Each character has a distinct combat role with a unique set of abilities which, when combined well, will compliment and reinforce other heroes.

The main goal of the game is to destroy the opponent's castle. In order to do so, you should control siege towers placed on the game board, and destroy enemy characters. You should carefully think through every move, keeping an eye on the opponent’s actions and pick characters paying attention to their strengths and weaknesses.

Note: This is not the same as Ð‘ÐµÑÑ‚Ð¸Ð°Ñ€Ð¸Ð¹ Ð¡Ð¸Ð³Ð¸Ð»Ð»ÑƒÐ¼Ð°. ÐšÐ¾Ð»Ð»ÐµÐºÑ†Ð¸Ð¾Ð½Ð½Ð¾Ðµ Ð¸Ð·Ð´Ð°Ð½Ð¸Ðµ (Bestiary of Sigillum: Collector's Edition) which came out several years before this and does not include Ð‘ÐµÑÑ‚Ð¸Ð°Ñ€Ð¸Ð¹ Ð¡Ð¸Ð³Ð¸Ð»Ð»ÑƒÐ¼Ð°: ÐÐ¾Ð²Ñ‹Ðµ Ð—ÐµÐ¼Ð»Ð¸ (Bestiary of Sigillum: Distant Lands).

Name: TRICKTAKERs Little
Description:
This is a new expansion set for Tricktakers.
Little Tricktakers compete in a combination in a battle of tricks.
You can not only select characters, but also strengthen your hand and select items.
Little Tricktakers was released at the Spring Tokyo Game Market 2022.

Name: BÁTR
Description:
In BÁTR, players will build warbands of Viking warriors and use them to raid and conquer local islands.

BATR is a game of area control and warfare where players will need to strategize and choose which island they should raid and in which order. They will also need to balance gold for the best outcome. The game comes in a small box and is easy to set up.

-description from designer

Name: Farm Frenzy
Description:
In Farm Frenzy each player has to make their own farm work by speed-drafting cards that need to be matched to produce tokens which in return are used to resolve contracts.

The game is high-speed and uses a common market concept where players can discard cards they don't need or can't use to the middle of the table and other may pick them up to use them. Of course, players gain points if other players used their cards, and so on.

Each player has their own deck that consists of the same number and types of cards, with the exception that each deck has a unique back representing the given player's faction.

When the game starts, each players will lay three cards from the top of their decks to the player board's farm area. Then the game really begins. There are no turns, the game is being played in real time. Players will reveal new cards, one by one, from their decks and try to pair them with cards they have laid down on the three farm spaces or any of the cards from the middle of the table where the common market is. Remember: using a card from another faction will win that faction extra points at the end of the game, so pay attention who discarded what card!

Players will try to match cards: One Hatchet paired with a Apple Garden will generate one Apple Basket token. One Scythe paired with a Grain Field will generate a Flour token. And finally, one Food Basket paired with a Pig Farm will generate one Pig token. Of course, there are variations of these cards in your deck. Once a player has enough tokens to resolve a Contract Card, they can do so and score it. Once a player has solved all their ten contracts, the game will end, and the exciting and nail-biting scoring will begin; you gain points from scored Contract Cards and one points from each of your cards the other players used.

That game is a true draw and pair bonanza!

—description from designer

Name: Relay Rivals
Description: Relay Rivals is a competitive team-based racing game where teams are trying to be the first to the finish line of an Epic Relay Race. As you navigate the course there will be hazards and power ups that will make the course harder or easier. However, going after the power ups causes you to detour off course which could be the difference between winning and losing the race. So your teams will have to discuss which pathway you want to go. Throughout the course you will stop at 3 Arenas! These arenas are the proving grounds where your team will relay race against the clock! Each team member will perform a different task while their teammates guess correct answers. You will need to get all of the tasks done in a row before the three-minute timer goes off in order to keep advancing down the board. Once you have made it to and completed the 3rd Arena you have reached the finish line and are the winners of Relay Rivals!

Name: Memoria Bluff
Description:
Introduction
You and your fellows have reached the city of Memoria, this mythical territory where snatches of memories come back to the mind of those who come in. Unfortunately, only one of you will be allowed to leave the city with his/her « new » memories. To be the chosen one, you’ll have to tell a memory or a lie while messing up with your companions’ minds.

Goal
The goal of the game is to tell a memory based on random pictures. If you don’t remember any memory with these pictures, you can still bluff creating a false memory, but try to be convincing! Indeed, to score points when you are the Speaker, you have to mislead the other players (in other words you must make them believe your memory is false when in fact it is true, or true when it is actually false).

ROUND 1
IN THE HEART OF THE CITY
You penetrate the heart of Memoria city. Snatches are springing up everywhere. Choose carefully the ones you’ll associate to tell or reinvente your story.
1) Everybody has 90 seconds to remember or to imagine a memory with the six visible cards (you can use your phone timer or leave it up to players to decide when they are ready to tell a memory). You don’t have to include the whole six cards to your memory. It is possible to tell a memory using only one card out of the six ones you picked.

2) Once everybody’s ready, the older player is designated as the Speaker. Then, he places in front of him and face down his « Bluff » card if he’s going to lie or his « Memoria » card, if he’s going to tell the truth. Then, he declares the number of pictures he’ll use in his memory and then tells it.

3) Once his memory has been told, each player (beginning with the player who is placed on his left) can ask a question to the Speaker if he wants to, in order to gather more information, or to unsettle him to see how he’ll react (If the Speaker’s memory is true, he has to answer the questions honestly. If his memory is false, he can tell what he wants).

4) Then, each player has to decide if the Speaker’s memory was true or false, placing his Memoria or Bluff card in front of him (His Memoria card if he thinks it was true, his Bluff card, if he thinks it was a lie).

5) Then, beginning with the player placed on the Speaker’s left, each player reveals his card, explaining if he wants to, why he believed or not in the Speaker’s memory. Then, the Speaker shows his own « Memoria » or « Bluff » card et gives some details about his story if he wants to.

6) Then, you have to count the points (see the following paragraph « How to count points »).

7) Then, the player who was sitting on the Speaker’s left becomes the Speaker, and so on and so forth until everybody’s been Speaker once.

8) Once the round is over, the 6 used « Snatch » cards are discarded.

ROUND 2
ON YOUR WAY BACK
It’s time to go back. You and your adventure fellows are about to leave the city of Memoria. Some snatches are still springing but soon, everything will turn back to the way it was before entering the city... However, one of you will have the privilege to keep in mind his new memories. But who ?

1) The Speaker draws the first « Snatch » card from the deck and has 45 seconds to remember or imagine a memory linked to this card.

2) He puts his « Memoria » or « Bluff » card in front of him and tells his memory.

3) The other players use their « Memoria » or « Bluff » card to decide if the Speaker’s memory was true or false. Contrary to the first round, they can’t ask him any questions.

4) The Speaker scores 3 points for each player who was wrong about his memory. The other players scores 3 points if they were right about the Speaker’s memory.

5) The drawn « Snatch » card is discarded and replaced with another one. Then, the player who was sitting on the Speaker’s left becomes the Speaker, and so on and so forth until everybody’s been Speaker twice during this round.

6) The game is over ! It’s time for you and your fellows to leave Memoria city. The one who has the highest score keeps his new memories with him. In case of a tie, don’t hesitate to go back to the city to decide who is the worthiest time traveller.

-description from designer

Name: Goetia: Nine Kings of Solomon – Sacrifice Promo Tile
Description:
GenCon promotional Scry Board/Dark Board tile.

Dark Board text: “You sense a Demonic presence! Whilst walking the halls of GenCon, you hear the strange chanting of Desciplees. Their current sacrifice draws forth a Demon! In exchange for some resources the Demon will grant you its powers!”

Name: Goetia: Nine Kings of Solomon – The Witch Promo Tile
Description:
Promotional Scry Board/Dark Board tile.

Dark Board text: “You sense a Demonic presence! It’s The Witch! Possessed by most powerful game designer of all! ALL HAIL Kristian and his Demons! Thanks for helping me make this game a reality!”

Name: Helsinki: Expansion 1
Description:
Contains 20 cardboard Pavilion tiles: 
5 "3"
5 multicolored "5"
5 bilcolored "5"
5 bilcolored "6"

This expansion comes in the Helsinki: Deluxe in acrylic.

Name: Hack.Jack
Description:
A 2-5 player hacking themed black jack deckbuilder. Players play cards from the top of their deck trying to get the sum of their played cards as close to the value on each job.

Buy new codes to add to your deck from one of 5 different suits. Each job has a unique event to try to capitalize on building your deck towards specific suits.

Players can activate those new code cards to knock the job value down, force players to play cards, or shuffle in troublesome antivirus scans into their deck. Whoever is the most notorious hacker at the end of the Final Hotshot hack, is victorious.

—description from the designer

Name: Grant: The Western Campaign of 1862
Description:
Early in 1862 a little-known general named U.S. Grant led the Union's offensive into West Tennessee. After capturing two river forts and the largest bag of prisoners ever captured by an American army to that time, Grant made a daring advance up the Tennessee River, while supporting armies advanced down the Mississippi and overland through Tennessee. But the Confederate army under A.S. Johnston hit back, staking everything on a furious battle in the woods around Shiloh Church.

GRANT: The Western Campaign of 1862 puts you in charge of the entire Tennessee campaign. As the Union player, you must coordinate three armies, using both naval and land forces to advance along the major rivers, take the important objectives of Nashville and Corinth, and seize the fortress of Island Number Ten to open the Mississippi River. As the Confederate player you are trying to block the Union offensives, choose your moment to counterattack, and if possible, take the war into Kentucky. Movement and combat by river is just as important as land, giving this campaign a unique feel in Civil War history. A chit-based sequence of play makes the game highly variable and models the abilities of Grant and Johnston.

—description from the publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: La Battaglia di Pavia
Description:
One of the many wargames designed by Guido Crepax for his own pleasure, featuring his beautiful paper soldiers. Published in the pages of the Italian Linus magazine in 1967-1969. Unfortunately the publication was never finished and the complete game remains unpublished to this day.

This game takes a more frivolous approach than Waterloo and combines Crepax's passions in colorful uniforms and in beautiful women, as immediately apparent from the gorgeous game board.

Women play an important part, and vivandieres, courtesans and spies can influence the fates of the battle. Moreover, mercenaries are unreliable and at risk of switching sides.

Name: Pit of Arms
Description:
Pit of Arms is a fast paced and competitive tabletop miniatures board game for 2 players. Inspired by tactical role playing video games, Pit of Arms players lead a team of hand picked gladiators and ruffians to do battle in the pits.

The game is played on a grid based arena, using collectible miniatures and their accompanying character cards. Players take turns rolling action dice allowing their gladiators to perform brutal attacks and cunning abilities.

Victory is achieved when a player concedes or only one player's gladiators remain standing in the arena.

—description from the designer

Name: Marvel Champions: The Card Game – Phoenix Hero Pack
Description:
One of the five original X-Men and a powerful psychic, Jean Grey was chosen as host for the cosmic Phoenix Force. As Phoenix, she uses her telepathy and telekinesis to protect mutants and humans alike, but she must always take care to not let the power of the Phoenix Force overcome her. Now, Phoenix blasts her way into players’ games of Marvel Champions: The Card Game! Phoenix is a psionic powerhouse that can draw on the unfathomable power of the Phoenix Force to face down any foe. With this Hero Pack, players will find Phoenix, her sixteen signature cards, and a full assortment of Justice cards inviting them to thwart the villain’s schemes.

Phoenix is a psionic powerhouse that can draw on the unfathomable power of the Phoenix Force to face down any foe. With this Hero Pack, players will find Phoenix, her sixteen signature cards, and a full assortment of Justice cards inviting them to thwart the villain's schemes. For players eager to challenge Magneto and his Brotherhood of Mutants, they can get started with the Phoenix Hero Pack! This expansion comes with a 40-card pre-built deck, giving players the chance to start playing right out of the box.

-description from the publisher's website
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Marvel Champions – The Card Game

Name: OMG I'm Famous
Description:
OMG I'm Famous! is the party game that gives you the chance to get verified, build influence, and be the first to reach 1 million followers. It's time to ditch your boring non-famous friends and social-climb your way to the top

Use "Problem Cards" to sabotage other players and prevent them from gaining followers

Use "Remedy Cards" to save yourself and keep gaining followers
The first person to 1 million followers wins!

Includes 105 cards with original illustrations. For 2-6 players ages 17+

description from publisher's website

Name: Who's the Silly Goose?
Description:
Are you becoming your parents? Call your friends out for getting old and developing habits like "Spends all day fantasizing about homes on Zillow" or "Has a crippling addiction to throw pillows".

Includes 150 most likely to prompt cards with viral meme characters like Rand and Nance.

—description from the publisher

Each round, a card is drawn showing some undesirable habit. Every player (except for the judge for that round) makes a case for which other player exhibits that habit most strongly. After hearing the arguments, the judge determines who gets the card. Then, the next player becomes the judge, and a new round begins. When a player has accumated seven cards, that player loses the game, and the game ends.

—user summary

Name: Lo Straordinario Gioco del Pugilato
Description:
A game of boxing, fruit of the creativity of Guido Crepax.

Published in book form with cut out drawings of 32 famous pugilists of the past, from the pioneers (John L. Sullivan, Bob Fitzsimmons) to the champions of the 1970s (Muhammad Ali, George Foreman, Joe Frazier).

Gameplay is based on the roll of the dice, which determine movement on the ring. Some boxers are slower than others (Primo Carnera), other move faster than the average (Sugar Ray Robinson, Muhammad Ali).

When the boxers are in adjacent squares, each roll a die to exchange punches. The one who rolls higher scores points. The boxers also have a limited number of powerful punches, for simplicity called "destri" (two dice) and "destri super" (three dice) allowing knock outs.

—user summary

Name: Tarock
Description: Traditional three-player trick taking game from Bavaria, Württemberg and Berlin, which adapts Tarock to be played with a pack of 36 German or French suited cards. For every hand players bid how many points they could take. The highest bidder announces trump and plays alone against the other two.

Name: KISS Rommel
Description:
Or Keep It Simple Stupid!

It's 1941-42 you are in charge of perhaps the entire Deutsches Afrika Korps or 8th Army! Most units equate to battalions giving about a dozen bases per Division. At this level of gaming only large tactically vital positions such as hilltop positions for a battalion become relevant, not looking for a hull-down position for a single tank!

The side that is moving will usually get in the first shot, so mobility is often better than standing still. In the desert it is easy to use space to pull back and blast the enemy at ranges where they cannot get at you.

—description from the rulesbook

An optional campaign system is also included.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: S.H.E.O.L.: Luminary Monks
Description:
This expansion for S.H.E.O.L. adds:
1. A new character, The Merciful, a support scout with high Lux and healing abilities. Thanks to her integrated jet pack, she can fly over obstacles to help her allies. 
2. Citadel Explorations, a new action that can be performed during the Development phase, providing greater insight into the world of Sheol.
3. A new base Shadow, the Sentinel. The Sentinel is a Shadow that does not move but can attack from a distance.
4. Dawn Outpost special land tile required for Mission 1 of the Luminaries' Campaign.

Name: S.H.E.O.L.: Engineer's Caste
Description:
This expansion for S.H.E.O.L. adds:

1. A new character, The Wrench, who can deploy powerful drones to ambush the Shadows and help allies with her repair skills.

2. Patrolling Mechs,which are a new type of unit representing the mechs that protect the perimeter of the Citadel (and certain other human outposts), providing new actions during the scout phase.

3. A new herald, the Skin Rider. This herald is a massive shadow that has taken control of a combat mech and its unfortunate pilot. The firepower of the mech adds to the power of the shadow itself, and the Scouts will have to work hard to bring it down!

Name: S.H.E.O.L.: Exiled Folks
Description:
This expansion for S.H.E.O.L. adds:

1. A new character, The Maul, a mighty, short-range warrior with the power to use corruption to enhance his abilities.

2. Corrupted Items, weapons and lanterns that increase in strength when they destroy shadows.

3. A new base Shadow, the Swarmer. The Swarmer grows stronger for each other Shadow nearby.

Name: S.H.E.O.L.: Tz'mitah
Description: This expansion for S.H.E.O.L. adds a fourth Outer Lord, Tz'mitah. Inspired by the fearsome real-world goblin shark,this mass of shadows became a gigantic tornado that devours everything it encounters on its way.

Name: Victory at Sea: USS Enterprise
Description:
Ships in Class: Yorktown, Hornet, Enterprise

Built in a series of three, only the USS Enterprise survived the war, with the USS Yorktown sunk during the Battle of Midway, and the USS Hornet during the Battle of Santa Cruz. The USS Enterprise went on to become the most frequently decorated US carrier of the war, even earning the British Admiralty Pennant, the only ship outside of the Royal Navy to do so. She was finally put out of action in 1945 by a kamikaze attack that severely damaged the hanger deck.

-description from the publisher's website

Name: Home from Oz: Expanded Starter Set
Description:
As you make your way home by following the Yellow Brick Road, you will encounter both friends and enemies. Beware of the Winged Monkeys or the Fighting Trees that will try to keep you from reaching home. Gain protection from obstacles by befriending the Cowardly Lion, Tin Woodman, and Scarecrow.

The Wicked Witch will try to stall your progress, but just as your friend Dorothy in her own journey through Oz, a simple Bucket of water will get you back on your way. What will happen when you encounter the Wizard or must pass through the Poppies?

If you’ve played the Original Game, you’re familiar with its twists and turns. This Expanded Starter Set paves the way to new possibilities. Get help from a Munchkin or be attacked by a Winkie Soldier. Visit the Emerald City or befriend Princess Ozma to unlock a wealth of new resources.

Find your own adventure when you get swept away by the Tornado into this mystical land.

-description from the back of the box

This set includes everything in the original game, plus more cards to expand the number of players, as well as new cards from a yet to be released expansion to the original version.

Name: Blood Red Skies: Kawanishi H8K Emily
Description:
The Imperial Japanese Navy (IJN) developed a number of flying boats as they were uniquely suited to conditions in the Pacific theatre due to their long ranges, heavy load carrying capacity, and the ability to land anywhere. The H8K, named 'Emily' by the Allies, was by far the most modern and successful flying boat deployed by the IJN and was rated as one of the best to see wartime service. A total of 167 H8Ks were built and they saw extensive use for patrol, reconnaissance, bombing, and transport duties. Its heavy defensive armament and robust airframe made it a difficult opponent for Allied flyers.

-description from the publisher's website
Families: Game: Blood Red Skies – Imperial Japanese Air Force

Name: Карты конфликта: Ыдишын 1 (Cards of Conflict – Edition 1)
Description:
Cards of Ð¡onflict (1 Edition) is a very controversial, if not “scandalous” game. In it, participants will select the most successful answers to strange questions. Uncensored. Without political correctness. No brakes. Cards of Ð¡onflict raises a wide variety of topics, often going far beyond the generally accepted norms of decency and etiquette. But if your company prefers black humor, banter over everything, and undisguised sarcasm, then this game is just what you need. Here you can plunge into the world of toilet jokes about orgies, people of non-standard sexual orientation, racism, and of course, laugh heartily at other charms of modern civilization.

Table of Contents Cards Board Game Content:

     30 cards with questions
     150 cards with answers
     rules of the game


The game begins with the fact that each player receives 10 white cards. In the first round, 1 player is selected - "Card Bro" of this round. "Card bro" takes 1 black card from the deck (black cards lie in one deck with the inscription down) and read out the text loudly. Each of the participants (except for "Card bro") chooses one of his white cards that seems to him the most suitable.

White cards are transferred to Card Bro, which in turn reads each option separately. We recommend that you reread the black card completely before reading out a new white card. "Card bro" is chosen by the winner, in his opinion, the option. The player whose white card wins this round receives a black card as a “ball."

At the end of the round, each player draws a new white card from the deck, so that at the beginning of the next round everyone has 10 white cards. White cards used in this round can be put down the white deck so that after a while they will return to them again. In each subsequent round, a new Card Bro is selected so that each player receives this role in turn. You yourself can choose the principle of changing “bro”: clockwise / counterclockwise, by height, age, leg size, or another sign that is understandable to all participants.

There are black cards in the deck, labeled “take 2”. In this case, each player must choose 2 white cards to form a winning combination. It is important to read the white cards in the correct order. Therefore, the card, the text of which you want to read first, you always need to put under the second card and so transmit "bro."

If you wish, you can modify the rules, for example, play without a “Card Bro”. In this case, each player votes for the option that he liked and gets the most votes with the score.

Name: Quintus
Description:
Quintus is a light-hearted yet tactical partnership trick-taking card game for five players, which is comparable in game mechanics to the Dutch game of Klaverjas (and its better known siblings Belote and Jass).

The game is played with a standard French deck, without twos, threes, fours and jokers -- 40 cards in total. The cards rank as usual, from 5 (low) to ace (high) in all suits.

The title stems from Latin and means `fifth'. This refers to the fifth player who plays alone, against the rest who play in two teams of two. The objective for all players is to take card points in tricks; the two teams combine their points while the quintus receives a card point bonus and the privilege to choose the trump suit. Jacks, queens and kings earn points while pip cards cost points. Additional points ("premiums") may be scored by winning combinations of cards in tricks.

As an alternative to a standard hand, the quintus may elect to play a nil hand in which he seeks to avoid taking any court card or ace.

Team mates may signal information about their cards through specific hand gestures.

As a variant to the base game, the quintus may be chosen through a bidding round in which the bid for the highest amount of combined card, nil and premium points wins.

Name: Карты Конфликта: Эпидемия (Cards of Conflict – Epidemic)
Description:
Cards of Ð¡onflict (Epidemic) is a "post-quarantine" independent addition to the board game about creating the funniest pairs of questions and answers. The authors collected all the most popular memes, phrases from quarantine tik-toks, Instagram tips, mistakes and human fears that were born during the worldwide Covid epidemic, and created a new version of the Conflict Maps so that you can laugh at what you experienced.

Table of Contents Cards Board Game Content:

     30 cards with questions
     150 cards with answers
     rules of the game


The game begins with the fact that each player receives 10 white cards. In the first round, 1 player is selected - "Card Bro" of this round. "Card bro" takes 1 black card from the deck (black cards lie in one deck with the inscription down) and read out the text loudly. Each of the participants (except for "Card bro") chooses one of his white cards that seems to him the most suitable.

White cards are transferred to Card Bro, which in turn reads each option separately. We recommend that you reread the black card completely before reading out a new white card. "Card bro" is chosen by the winner, in his opinion, the option. The player whose white card wins this round receives a black card as a “ball."

At the end of the round, each player draws a new white card from the deck, so that at the beginning of the next round everyone has 10 white cards. White cards used in this round can be put down the white deck so that after a while they will return to them again. In each subsequent round, a new Card Bro is selected so that each player receives this role in turn. You yourself can choose the principle of changing “bro”: clockwise / counterclockwise, by height, age, leg size, or another sign that is understandable to all participants.

There are black cards in the deck, labeled “take 2”. In this case, each player must choose 2 white cards to form a winning combination. It is important to read the white cards in the correct order. Therefore, the card, the text of which you want to read first, you always need to put under the second card and so transmit "bro."

If you wish, you can modify the rules, for example, play without a “Card Bro”. In this case, each player votes for the option that he liked and gets the most votes with the score.

Name: Карты Конфликта: Сборник ваших тупых идей (Cards of Conflict – A Collection of Your Stupid Ideas)
Description:
Many, playing this game, died of laughter, and those who survived not only learned to spew toilet and black jokes for any reason at any time of the day, but also began to come up with ideas for new cards themselves. The result of these efforts and collective insanity was a new addition to the game "Cards of Conflict", which the publishers affectionately called "The Collection of Your Stupid Ideas." Each card is not only very dumb, but also unique! The addon came out, as they say, unrealistically cool and does not repeat any of the games in the series. It can be played on its own or with other games in the series. In the set you will find 30 cards with questions and 150 with answers.

JOKES FOR THREE HUNDRED OR LEARN TO PLAY A TRACTOR OPERATOR

If you joked so that you forgot how to play, then we will remind you. If this does not help, please see a doctor as soon as possible. So, each participant receives 10 white as snow or what you can joke about in this game, cards with answers. A deck of black (no, we are not racists!) cards with questions is laid out in the center of the table. The first player, known in a friendly way as "card bro" or worse in some companies, takes the top card of the black deck and reads the question aloud. The rest of the players must choose the most ridiculous, as they think, answer and lay out one of their cards. Bro repeats the question one more time, and then reads out the answers of the participants.

The author of the funniest answer gets a victory point. Players take one white card into their hand and the next player draws a question. The carousel of select toilet humor begins to rotate with renewed vigor. The winner is the one who scores the maximum number of points.

Name: Escape from Hallow Hall
Description:
The exterior of Hallow Hall looks truly menacing, and the insides of this long-abandoned house are filled with things that go bump! in the night... or so the legends say.  You and your brave team of paranormal investigators have made your way inside hoping for the ultimate ghost bust but with the sun starting to set, you're wondering whether you've bitten off more than you can chew!

Gather your friends and get ready to face your fears with this spine-chilling escape room game!  Players must solve four puzzles to get the clues needed to make their escape from one of the 12 different exits to choose from.  Will you be able to crack the puzzles and find your way to safety, or will you be trapped forever with the hair-raising horrors lurking within?

Name: The Tower of the Ice Lich
Description:
The Tower of the Ice Lich is a fast, simple, solo-adventure dungeon card game created as a pixelated homage to 16-bit videogames, fantasy RPGs, and classic Sword and Sorcery literature.

Choose between 4 characters. Face multiple challenges in the form of 30 unique rooms and 30 different events and acquire 12 marvelous items that help you on the way to defeat the Lich and its 9 special attacks.

Replay and experience a different tower the next time. Or use the cards as inspiration when you need a quick dungeon for your regular RPG session.

Name: Operation Iron Brain: The Siege of Beirut, June-August 1982
Description:
Operation Iron Brain: The Siege of Beirut, June-August, 1982.

For over a year the Palestinian Liberation Organization (PLO) had bombarded Israel’s northern province of Galilee with artillery and rocket fire. On June 6, 1982 the Israeli military invaded southern Lebanon in an operation dubbed “Peace for Galilee”. The Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) quickly defeated the PLO’s armed forces and drove north. Although the declared aim of the Israeli offensive was to clear a 40 kilometer “buffer zone” along the Lebanese/Israeli border, Israeli Defense Minister, Ariel Sharon, was determined to eradicate the PLO once and for all, and hopefully kill its leader, Yassir Arafat. With new orders the IDF crossed the Litani River and drove on Beirut where the remnants of the PLO’s forces were retreating, and where most of their refugee camps were located. What ensued was an escalating conflict that threatened to engulf the entire mid-east once more in conflict and bring Lebanon to the brink of abyss of genocidal civil war.

Each copy of Operation Iron Brain is composed of the following:

•    Two 11 by 17 inch hex map sheets
•    One sheet of 140 double-sided, unmounted counters
•    One Players’ Aid Sheet
•    8 pages of rules

Armor and Infantry (Militia, Regular, Heavy Weapons) units are all Battalions. Airborne and militia units are companies. A hex on the map is about a half mile across. Each turn represents two weeks of time. The game is designed by Paul Rohrbaugh and features graphics by David Gomez Prieto.

-description from designer

Name: Medieval Champion
Description:
Medieval Champion is a fast paced dueling card game for 2 or 4 players. Invoke a set of unique champions into a duel that will include combat, magic, treasures and trickery!

Each champion has a set of skills and attributes that modify how you use action cards. There are also fun items and special artifacts that will help boost your champion to victory.

Each card is hand painted with designs in ink and watercolour, then digitally remastered into the final product. This adds to the vintage feel!

Name: Invasie van de plantenplagen
Description:
Each player plays the role of a plant pest; for example an insect, virus, or fungus. During the game, they try to spread to all the regions of the world; the pest that's in the most regions at the end wins the game.

On a player's turn, they first add a number of their playing pieces to the board, and then they can move a number of pieces to neighbouring countries. Finally they can evolve their species by "upgrading" one of their genetic characteristics (e.g. the number of pieces they can add each turn, the number of pieces they can move, and the climate zones that their species can live in).

The game 'Plant pest invasion' was published on the occasion of the UN International Year of Plant Health (2020).

Name: American Mogul
Description:
The industrial revolution marked a turning point in American history. The transition from handmade items to large-scale factories with industrial machinery made it possible to produce products at an epic scale. It also turned a handful of already industrious men into even more; it turned them into American moguls. Will you be one of them?

In American Mogul, players are captains of industry throughout the length of the industrial revolution in the United States, with each attempting to corner markets in the emerging states. Done through a brutally tight action-selection mechanism in which no action can be chosen twice in a round, the game is palpably tense as players struggle to get the right contracts, the best companies, and the edge in every market.

American Mogul is a follow up to 2013's Global Mogul, using the same core systems and adding more to it. Players now have captain cards that give each player a unique starting position and a special ability. Event cards make every play unique and interesting, but rather than random events, each player chooses an event during initial set-up. Players also choose a unique endgame scoring condition for each game, adding even more to the variability. Finally, a new action allows players to donate money to their own private foundations, then watch that money grow as the public matches donations and the interest accrues from round to round. The more players grow their foundations, the more special abilities they unlock. In a game that's brutally tight on money, how much will you give away? Will you be a philanthropist or a robber baron?

Name: ビビッドパニック コンガラッチョ (Vivid Panic Kongaraccho)
HEX!
Description: Play numbers and or action cards on common discard pile. Match either card face or colour. If none of your hand cards match, draw a new card from the deck. Say HEX! as soon as you have one card in hand.

Name: Horrorclix: Predators Seven Figure Collector's Set
Description:
The most dangerous hunters in the galaxy are training their young here on Earth. Upon their arrival in the Antarctic, tney learn that their target prey—the fearsome Aliens—have been released by human explorers. Not only that, but the Predators are without their full complement of weapons. Now these young Predators are fighting on two fronts—with deadly, all-new rules.
This second of three Alien vs. Predator HorrorClix sets expands your game with evertyhing you need to bring AVP to your game table.
Whoever wins... we lose!

—description from the back of the box

Released with The Lab expansion set, this set contains 6 Predators and a human Apprentice Predator, as well as Plot Twist cards, victims, and a map.

Name: Frog Safari
Description:
As a frog scientist it is up to you to collect 3 frogs from the jungle! They could be red, green or blue, small, medium or large and can be found in the swamp, the forest or the lake! The player who collects 3 frogs with the most matches in color size and location wins the round. The explorer with the highest frog scores after all the rounds wins!

You must collect in your pocket 3 frogs of your choice. When you find a frog you want to collect this round remove it from your hand and place it in front of you, locking it in your pocket. Once you've locked in your 3 frogs, you start the clock on your opponents. They must now complete their pockets swiftly to collect as many points as possible before the round ends.

As players draw from the deck they can keep or discard the frog they find, if they do, it's up for grabs by your opponents! You can also steal, snatch or switch frogs with your opponents!

-description from designer

Name: Northgard: Uncharted Lands – Warchiefs
Description:
Your Clan will grant you a special power and unique clan cards to create and upgrade your deck. The Warchief expansion also brings you a dedicated warchief, coming both with a permanent power and a new card to add to your upgrades.

Each of the 7 clans brings asymmetrical player powers.
Bear clan, Goat clan, Raven clan, Stag clan, Wolf clan, Boar clan and the Snake clan.

Containing:

     5 Modular playerboards for 5 player colors 
     7 Modular playerboards for 7 clans.
     7 Warchief upgrade cards (1 card per clan)
     7 Warchief miniatures
     1 Kaija miniature 
     10 colorer plastic rings
     Rulebook

Name: Northgard: Uncharted Lands – Wilderness
Description:
Introducing some advanced creatures beside the already existing "classic" creatures like wolfs or the brown bear.
The 8 new creatures are: 
2x Draugr Jötunn/Eldthurs/Spectral Warrior, 
1x Wyvern and Heidrun
They come with their 8 creature cards.

Beside the new creatures, you will find a module of 11 special environmental tiles. Introducing tiles with special effects. Like geysers - they increase your happiness and resilience to winter. In Uncharted Lands, it allows you to place one extra viking for free in the Geyser’s territory at the end of the turn, as your units reap its benefits to invigorate themselves and get ready to jump into the fray!

Name: Le Secret des Templiers
Description:
Le Secret des Templiers ("Secret of the Templars") is an escape game for 3+ players with a game master who'll hide some hints in the room and give clues when the other are blocked. For more roleplay, each player can have a specific role, such as treasure guardian, grand inquisitor, etc...

Together, the players have to solve puzzles to find the Holly Grail.

Name: Northgard: Uncharted Lands – Warchief Collector Edition
Description:
The Warchief Collector Edition is a Kickstarter Exclusive containing the base game of Northgard: Uncharted Lands including the Wilderness expansion, Warchiefs expansion, module of special environmental tiles.

All the content is put into one big box and filled by custom inserts to ease the setup and game play.


Based on the universe of the Northgard video game, Northgard: Uncharted Lands is a game of conquest and exploration set in the age of vikings. Each player controls a Viking clan, looking to achieve victory by reaping glory in various ways or controlling the most prized territories of this new continent.

The game focus is on streamlined rules and mechanisms, allowing for a fast-paced and smooth rhythm of play. Each turn, players alternate their actions to adapt their strategies to their opponents' moves and the expansion of the board. Fame (i.e., points) can be earned by exploring, fighting, and controlling and developing territories. The various corresponding actions are played through the cards that the players have in hand. At the end of each turn, they have to choose a new card to improve their personal deck as their clans develop new tactics and technologies.

The conquest of Northgard also requires clever management of resources to build new buildings, improve your warriors' effectiveness, better your hand of cards, and upgrade your clan's specificities. The winter phase makes this management more difficult as you have to feed your units to keep them healthy and happy.

The pace of the game is set by the players as the game ends after seven turns, but can also be cut short at any time if one of them is in control of three closed territories hosting certain types of buildings.

'--description from the publisher's website

Name: Kuflibingó
Description:
Classic bingo game with Kufli graphics. 
The rules have two variants.

One is for 3+ years olds. You flip a tile and if you see that picture on your board you can take it and continue flipping until you flip one that you don’t have. Turn down that tile and it is the next players turn. You win if you collect all the pictures first.

The other is for 4+ years olds. It is a quick reaction bingo game. Each player flips one tile at the same time. If you see one that you have on your board you have to be the fastest to touch it. Yoou can collect multiple tiles in one round, one after the other. You win if you collect all the pictures first.

Name: Justice League Snaps
Description:
A card game with DC Characters : WonderWoman, Superman and Batman, but also villains, such as The Joker or Harley Quinn.

It's a speed game where you are trying to get rid of your cards as fast as possible. When placing cards, each card placed must be same color, same character or same number than the previous one. Placing a Villain will give a penalty to your opponents.

Name: Minerały: Promo 2 – Narzędzia
Description:
Additional tools
Two-sided tiles with new tools. Use them interchangeably with tools from the basic game. Before each game prepare 5 tiles with tools (each one with different mineral color) in these order: white, blue, pink, black, gold.

Name: Maja: Polli Hop
Description:
In the beehive a party is organized to honor the Queen Bee. Maja and her friends want to bring her the best honey from the Corn Poppy Meadow. But Maja must plan carefully, each friend can only carry three pollen balls. You have pollen balls of a color, roll the die and must place a pollen ball to one of Maja’s friends or Ant Paul. You try to place your pollen in 3rd place as often as you can. If you manage that in all boxes, you earn a Maja Chip and win after three rounds with most chips.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Android: Netrunner – Overdrive Runner Draft Pack
Description:
This is the Runner's draft pack for the Overdrive event. Draft packs contain 40 cards separated into 4 randomized boosters of 10 cards each. After the selection process, each layer builds a deck from their pool of drafted cards and use those decks to compete in a tournament.

Afterwards, the draft pack may be used in another draft event or the player may use the cards in the Android Netrunner game.

Name: Arcadia Quest: Black Newt
Description: The self-named ‘Black Newt’ is the son of a very large and wealthy Arcadian family who had the misfortune of being born last. His sisters were beautiful, his brothers were dashing, and all his elder siblings were intelligent, witty, and noble. Alas, the Black Newt had the heart of a troll. Sniping was his second nature, the cutting barb was his forte, and he even took to stealing their diaries to scrawl snarky comments in the margins. He was eventually disowned. But he had learned swordsmanship to at least a competent degree, and a Guild membership was easy enough for someone of his connections. Ironically, he welcomed the invasion, but was cast out when he was found scrawling derisive comments beneath graffiti the orcs would leave on each other’s’ walls. Heart of a troll indeed.

Name: Peg It
Description:
The board is set up with the 14 RED pegs in the holes ringed with Red, 14 BLUE pegs in the holes ringed with Blue, the YELLOW KEY peg in the Red Star, and the GREEN KEY peg in the Blue Star.

The game is won by the player who first positions his KEY peg in the diagonally opposite square or blocks any further move by his opponent.
A player may move over his own or the opponent's single pegs in one or more successive steps as in "Draughts" or from hole to hole in FORWARD or DIAGONAL direction only. No side or backward movement is allowed. KEY pegs may be moved ONLY along the straight arrowed line from STAR to SQUARE, and only the KEY pegs should be placed in the squares. No pegs are to be removed from the board.

Name: SeaLiT: Mediterranean Ships and Trade in the Long Nineteenth Century
Description:
SeaLiT the game is the fruit of a research project in Maritime History, the ERC STG 2016 project entitled ‘Seafaring Lives in Transition, Mediterranean Maritime Labour and Shipping, 1850s-1920s’(SeaLiT). The game is an entertaining and educational journey into the world of maritime history of the Mediterranean and Black Sea during the long nineteenth century, namely from the French Revolution to the World War I as defined by the historian Eric Hobsbawm.

In the game players take on the role of shipowners and must develop their business, upgrade their ships, and adapt their strategies to the changing circumstances caused by external factors. While playing the game, players will explore the universe of maritime trade, they will get a feel for its mechanisms and its historical evolution and they will learn more about:

     The main types of sailing ships and steam ships used in maritime trade.
     The important ports of the Mediterranean and the Black Sea in the nineteenth century.
     The important commodities traded during this period.
     The navigation rules that dictated the way ships sailed back in time. 
     The mechanisms of shipping industry like demand, freight rates, insurance, ship repairing etc.
     The external factors that affected shipping industry like wars, epidemics, strikes etc.


Players acting like shipowners seek to overcome their opponents financially. Due to the long number of rounds (120) which coincides with each year from 1790 to 1910, players may choose to start the game at any year and they also may decide to finish it after any number of rounds. An average number of 30 to 40 rounds coincides with approximately two and a half to three hours of play. Thus, the game offers indirectly different scenarios corresponding at different periods (age of sail, 1790-1830, age of early steamships 1840 to 1860 and so on). The winner is determined by the player who possesses more value after counting money, value of ships and value of cargo, minus any loans he/she might owe to the bank.

The players move in the map through the navigation cards, which determine the speed of the ships/pawns, and various events that occur (gales, pirates, shipwrecks, fire). Players seek to sell the carrying cargo, to buy bigger and technologically more advanced vessels and to capture most of the Mediterranean market. In the age of sail period, 1790-1830, they also can buy one or more privateers to capture and convert other players' ships. They have to roll the dice only when they have to determine the demand (high or low) of the ten commodities of the game every five rounds, and when they have to face pirates or privateers.

Name: Hová bújtál, Boribon?
Description:
The competitive version is based on the children's game hide and seek. One player controls Annipanni and tries to find Boribon. The other player controls Boribon, Szuszi and Hapci. The character tiles are face down so Annipanni has to investigate them to find the one with the bear. Annipanni rolls the die and decides which direction she wants to go. The other player also rolls and decides the direction and which of their tiles they want to move. This way vou jump from card to card and flip one in each round. If Annipanni finds Boribon she wins. If there are no more cards face up Boribon wins.

In the cooperative version you all control together the animals and try to protect Boribon from Annipanni catching him. You start with the cards face down and if you can name the card you jump to with any character you can flip it. If you flip all the cards you win. You can use the dog and cat to stop Annipanni in her round and help Boribon to get away. If Annipanni catches Boribon you loose.

Name: Ladrón de Frutas
Description:
Ladrón de Frutas ("Fruit Thief") is a simple and straightforward game for family and friends, from 2 to 8 players. The main objective is to gather the specific fruits that appear in one of the game cards.

Ladrón de frutas es un juego simple y sencillo para la familia y amigos, de 2 a 8 jugadores. El objetivo principal es reunir las frutas concretas que aparecen en una de las cartas de juego.

Name: Dead Reckoning: Letters of Marque
Description:
After year of the New Sea being the dominion of cutthroat pirates, and daring merchant adventurers, the empires of the old world have turned their gaze towards its waters.

Letters of Marque is the third Saga expansion for Dead Reckoning. It contains 2 distinct but interconnected sets of expansion content. The first is "Flags of the Old World", a non-saga based set of content that introduces 2 empire boards, new resources called "Prime Cargo", new ship upgrades and a new "Explorer" card for each player's deck. The second is a new Saga, which, like to prior Saga expansions, contains encounters, mysteries, cards and content all to be organically while playing the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dingsi: die wilde Zahlenpyramyde
Description:
The aim of the wild number pyramid "Dingsi" is to reach as many and high rows of numbers as possible by swapping and using drawn cards. By trying to get a row with the same number you need skill and tactics. The signal word "Dingsi" should used in a targeted manner to prevent other players to get points.

—description from the publisher

Dingsi die wilde Zahlenpyramide ist ein Kartenspiel der etwas anderen Art. Das Ziel bei der wilden Zahlenpyramide "Dingsi" ist das Erreichen möglichst vieler und hoher Zahlenreihen durch das Tauschen und Einsetzen gezogener Karten. Beim Versuch, eine Reihe mit der gleichen Zahl zu erreichen, ist vor allem Geschick und Taktik gefragt. Dabei sollte auch das Signalwort "Dingsi" gezielt eingesetzt werden, um das Punkten der Mitspieler zu verhindern

—description from the publisher (German)

Name: Patou'che
Description:
In Patou'che!, each player embodies a shepherd who dreams of having the largest flock of sheep. But watch out for the prowling wolf, he also likes sheep, but to eat them! In order to protect their sheep, players can count on their faithful sheepdogs: the Patous. A cooperative mode also allows everyone to play together against the wolf.

On a player’s turn, they can roll the dice up to 3 times, keeping at least 1 die after each roll. The wolf side causes the wolf to move, the sheep side wins a sheep, and the sheepdog side wins a patou. Once the result of the dice suits the player, or after a maximum of 3 throws, the action of each die is applied.

As soon as a player has 6 Sheep cards, each of the other players plays one last time. The player with the most Sheep on all his cards is declared the winner. In case of a tie, the player with the fewest Sheepdog cards wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dwarf Mine: Magestone Mountain
Description:
Deep below Magestone Mountain there lies a source of great power. Leylines of magestone wind their way through the stone of the mountain! Your mine will dig deep as you gather the two types of magestone – pure and corrupted – and learn the arcane spells needed to unleash their power. Will this magic bring glory and prestige to your mine? Or will the dangerous elementals and power-hungry wizards that roam deep in the mountain spell your doom? Play to find out, as your mine tells its story!

Magestone Mountain is an expansion to Dwarf Mine (the Dwarf Mine base game is required to play).

Like Dwarf Mine, Magestone Mountain is a game played by drawing a mine on graph paper. On your turn, you will first draw (dig) rooms, hallways, and ladders for your mine! Rooms will benefit your mine, and hallways and ladders let you reach other areas of your mountain.

After drawing, you will make two dice rolls - a treasure roll, and a combat roll. These rolls determine what treasure you find, and what creatures you may encounter in the mountain - after all, mining is dangerous business!

Each mine made has a story, and every story has a beginning, middle, and sadly, an end. Your game ends when your population reaches 0. By the end of the game, you’ll have created rich and unique history for your mine – no two games are the same!

Players are getting VP during the game and trying to see how many VP they can get each time they play. Kind of like a high score.

—description from the publisher

Name: BattleTech: Turning Points – Foster
Description:
Death to the dishonorable! Eager to take revenge on the devious Smythe-Jewels, Clans Coyote and Hell’s Horses announced a Trial of Possession for all of the Fire Mandrill Kindraa’s holdings and legacies. The no holds barred campaign saw innovative strategies and state-of-the-art technology come into play in the Kindraa’s fight for survival. Desperate maneuvers and sly battle plans swung the battle back and forth. Turning Points: Foster details the fate of Kindraa Smythe-Jewel in a titanic struggle in the Kerensky Cluster during the Golden Century.

Turning Points: Foster uses Chaos Campaign rules to give players the option of fighting individual battles or to follow a campaign arc. Included are a detailed map of the world of Foster, a run down of the forces involved, and scenario tracks recreating the battles.

Name: Imperamus
Description:
Imperamus is an all-encompassing, strategic Euro-Ameri experience which transports players to the early days of the Roman Republic, at the very beginning of their conquest of the Italian peninsula. Players take on the role of noble Roman families who must balance competition with cooperation to expand the borders of Rome and create a civilization that can stand the test of time for centuries to come. This narrative game promotes constant player interaction across all four branches of command - military, legislature, diplomacy, and economy.
At its core, Imperamus is a card-driven, deck-building system supported by traditional worker placement, resource management, and engine building. Players must balance crucial decisions as military leaders and statesmen to build their own local influence while supporting the formation of the Legions for the expansion of Rome as a whole. Along with the ability to customize their decks with recruits from Rome and surrounding societies, each family has a unique power to guide their strategy. Additionally, players will vote on both in-game laws and out-of-game scoring conditions, creating a new mechanical framework for each campaign!
While the group has a common goal to gain the support of the people and ultimately give rise to the longest lasting empire in history, only one family will leave a legacy for the ages. The player with the most glory at the end of the game wins!

Name: Heisenburger
Description:
An unfortunate mishap involving a particle collider and a physicist’s lunch has led to the creation of a quantum burger. You and the other players take on the role of competing scientists from parallel realities. The only way to ensure your survival, is to make sure that most of the burger’s ingredients stay in your reality.

Heisenburger is a competitive card game for 2 - 4 players. Each player is dealt a hand of nine, numbered ingredient cards in their chosen color. On their turn, players can add ingredients to the burger by playing one of their cards, face-down. Players can challenge each other by playing a card and guessing if their card is higher or lower than an opponent’s card. If guessed correctly, the challenger replaces their opponent’s ingredient card with their own.

Some ingredient cards score bonus points, based on where they are placed in the burger. Others have special powers that are triggered when they are revealed.

At the end of the game, players score one point for each ingredient card of their color in the finished burger. Plus any bonus points awarded by card powers. The player with the most points wins the game.

-description from designer

Name: Cheesy Heist
Description:
Players take turns sabotaging their friends and collecting cards while hoping for Cheese until someone decides to unleash the Cat! Everyone drops their cards face-down on the table, and the real heist begins. Players take any card they want, no matter to whom it belonged previously! They use their sixth sense and deducting skills to steal precious Cheese while looking directly at the scared eyes of their friends. It’s madness, you would say, but there are a lot of ways to win this game!

The first one to collect 5 Cheese cards and get rid of all Cat cards from their hand wins! But in the end, players will still be friends, because there are no harsh feelings in this game.

-description from designer

Name: Monster Hunter International
Description:
Step into the world of Monster Hunter International, the most thematic and action-packed miniatures game inspired by Larry Correia's New York Times best-selling novels. Dive into epic, dice-chucking skirmishes where every roll could mean victory or doom in a tactical, competitive showdown of epic proportions!

Choose from a roster of truly unique Hunters and Monsters, each one pulled straight from the books and brought to life with stunningly detailed miniatures, making every game a tabletop spectacle. Will you assemble a team of ruthless Monsters, each with their own sinister skills and monstrous abilities, or lead a squad of Hunters wielding epic weaponry, ready to take on the supernatural? Each character stands ready, packed with dynamic abilities, powerful gear, and distinct personalities that make every game unforgettable.

Whether you’re playing grid-based or free-measurement style (rules for both are included!), the game’s highly immersive design will have you strategizing across a multitude of game modes and objectives. It’s not just a battle—it’s a war for survival, where every roll and every move matters. With a huge variety of objectives, no two games are the same. Gear up, roll those dice, and bring your best game face because Monster Hunter International isn’t just a game—it’s the ultimate, monster-stomping adventure for fans of epic dice-chucking fun!

Name: Zombicide: 2nd Edition – The Boys: Pack 1 – The Seven
Description:
The Boys and The Seven Are Ready to Make Some Zombie Heads Explode

Vought International’s super hero team, The Seven, may be seen as celebrities by much of the world, but the members of The Boys know the dark underside of the super hero life. This vigilante group has made it their goal to put a stop to Vought’s plans and they’re willing to go through The Seven to get there.

And then the zombie apocalypse happened. The Boys and The Seven now have to set aside their differences to fight the zombie threat!

THE BOYS Character Packs brings characters from the iconic THE BOYS series to player’s tabletops, adding them to Zombicide 2nd Edition as Survivors!

Pack #1 includes: Homelander, Queen Maeve, The Deep, Black Noir, Starlight, A-Train, and Soldier Boy Survivors, plus 7 ID Cards, 7 Ultimate Skill Reference Cards, and Rules Leaflet.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Zombicide: 2nd Edition – The Boys: Pack 3 – Supe Abominations
Description:
The Boys and The Seven Are Ready to Make Some Zombie Heads Explode

Vought International’s super hero team, The Seven, may be seen as celebrities by much of the world, but the members of The Boys know the dark underside of the super hero life. This vigilante group has made it their goal to put a stop to Vought’s plans and they’re willing to go through The Seven to get there.

And then the zombie apocalypse happened. The Boys and The Seven now have to set aside their differences to fight the zombie threat!

THE BOYS Character Packs brings characters from the iconic THE BOYS series to player’s tabletops, adding them to Zombicide 2nd Edition as Survivors!

Pack #3 includes: Exclusive Homelander Abomination plus 6 Compound V Equipment Cards, 6 Milk & Nuts Equipment Cards, 8 Abomination Cards, and Rules Leaflet.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Zombicide: 2nd Edition – The Boys: Pack 2 – The Boys
Description:
The Boys and The Seven Are Ready to Make Some Zombie Heads Explode

Vought International’s super hero team, The Seven, may be seen as celebrities by much of the world, but the members of The Boys know the dark underside of the super hero life. This vigilante group has made it their goal to put a stop to Vought’s plans and they’re willing to go through The Seven to get there.

And then the zombie apocalypse happened. The Boys and The Seven now have to set aside their differences to fight the zombie threat!

THE BOYS Character Packs brings characters from the iconic THE BOYS series to player’s tabletops, adding them to Zombicide 2nd Edition as Survivors!

Pack #2 includes: Billy Butcher, Hughie, Annie ‘Starlight’, Kimiko, Frenchie, and Mother’s Milk Survivors, plus Terror the Bulldog, 6 ID Cards, 2 Ultimate Skill Reference Cards, 1 Terror Equipment Card, 1 Laser Baby Equipment Card, and Rules Leaflet.

-description from publisher

Name: Stradivari
Description:
Each player is a member of the Italian family Stradivari. The Stradivari were violin makers known for the creation of the prestigious music intruments: the Stardivarius.

In Stradivari, players will have to gather materials to craft music instruments to score points.

Players will be able to gather materials by placing their workers on the game board. During the course of the game, players may upgrade their workers to make them gather even more materials when they are placed on the board.

The players with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

Name: ダービージョッキー (Derby Jockey)
Description:
In ãƒ€ãƒ¼ãƒ“ãƒ¼ã‚¸ãƒ§ãƒƒã‚­ãƒ¼ (Derby Jockey), players will complete in 4 trial races, building up to a final derby race.

The game includes cards corresponding to different horses with speed, strength, and stamina numbers; cards that show special abilities that can be acquired; and cards that give horses a boost.

Most turns involve a player rolling a die and advancing that many spaces; players may use "leg" cards to increase their die, but must declare how many they are using prior to rolling the die.

The player who wins the derby race wins.

Name: Live a Live
Description:
Based off the video game of the same name, Live-A-Live was exclusively available as part of the Japanese-only Collector's Edition when the remake released on the Nintendo Switch.

The winner is the player who reduces the opponent's two characters to zero life by selecting four of each of the eight main characters in the game and making full use of the three techniques each has.

Name: Blood & Plunder: Fire on the Frontier
Description:
As the idea of a frontier began to emerge, two wars would erupt which would act as a precedent for much of the Anglo-Indian and Anglo-French conflict over the next one hundred years. King Phillip’s war in 1675 would be the first time the colonies were ever forced to co-operate against a highly mobile indigenous enemy whos tactics of raid and ambush would typify the type of warfare that would terrorize the Frontier life. King William’s war 1689-1697 would be the first in what would become known as the French and Indian wars, and is seen by some as the first truly global war as it was fought between rival European powers from Flanders to the Caribbean and beyond; vicious and combining both western and frontier styles of fighting, King William’s war would start a cycle of violence that would continue until the French cession of Canada to the British in 1763.

This expansion will require the No Peace Beyond the Line Expansion Book.

Softcover, 78 pages

Name: Dark Age: Skarrd
Description:
Mutants. Psychics. Cannibals. Monsters. The Skarrd are all these things and much more. For generations the barbarian tribes have evolved and transformed into the survival-of-the-fittest cults. Samaria has suffered the raids and ambushes of the Skarrd for as long as they have hunted for flesh to fill their bellies and machine parts to replace their own failing bodies.

The Skarrd are a savage horde that has broken into several distinct cults based on how their teachings and ideals force them to evolve and survive the hellish environments of Samaria. The cults focus on what drives and strengthens them, turning each sect within the greater Horde into a distinct family of brutal, barbaric marauders. There is the sado-masochism of the Blood Cult, the conversion from flesh to machine within the Cult of Metamorphosis, the body ravaging poisons f the Toxic Cult, and now the animated death and nuclear powers of the newly risen Cult of Decay. All are strengthened by the Horde, but each in their own way.

Over a decade since his exile from New Ashkelon, Saint-turned-Father Johann has been gathering all of the Skarrd under his collective banner at the dreaded Fort Retribution. Something tremendous and horrifying is happening within the Skarrd and there is only one thing to be assured of - they might be the only ones to survive it.

Name: Dark Age: Forsaken
Description: As the last bastion of advanced human civilization on Samaria, the Forsaken consider it their holy duty to erradicat all menaces to human existance. Aliens, heratics, and abominations abound across the planet, and the Forsaken have taken up arms in a holy crusade to wipe the world clean in the Forsaken God's name.

Name: Bites: Promo Cards Pack
Description:
Promo from the Kickstarter for Bites: New Recipes.

Includes: 2 new Special Rule cards, 1 new Chocolate rule card, 3 bubblegum tokens, and a rainbow ant.

Name: The Shame of Life
Description:
Every minute someone, somewhere is second guessing what they’re about to say. We’re all guilty of it: shaming ourselves into silence for fear of not fitting in.

It’s time we break our silence. It’s time we celebrate the little weirdos we are. It’s time we beat The Shame of Life.

Players take turns reading questions written on the cards while every one else tries to verbally give their best reply if they can think of one. Once everyone is satisfied with their response, the lead play chooses their favorite response to get the point for the round. This is a game that can last as long as your party does. First to win 5 rounds wins or who ever has the most points by the time you decide to stop playing, wins.

Name: Lawyer Up: Season 1
Description:
The season 1 cases for Lawyer Up all in one box. Contains:

- Prosecution/Defense Decks
- Case 00: Art Forgery case (from Lawyer Up base box)
- Case 01: Murder case (Lawyer Up base Box)
- Case 02: Godfather case (Expansion)
- Case 03: Witch Trial case (Expansion)

Name: Shuhari
Description:
Shuhari is a trick-taking game about mastering traditional Japanese arts, such as ikebana, the koto, and calligraphy.

The cards in the game each show 3 of 5 different suits, in an angularly radial pattern, so that each card has an outer suit, middle suit, and inner suit.

Each person will play 3 or 4 cards to each trick, one at a time in turn order, depending upon the player count.  Each trick also has up to three stages.  In the first stage, players are following the "outer suit" of the lead card.  However, if someone is able to following unconventionally, the trick proceeds to the next stage and players are now trying to follow the lead suit, but with the middle suit on their card.  In the last stage of a trick, players follow the outer suit of the initial lead card with the inner suit of their card.

Once the card play is completed, each stage of a trick will have a winner and that winner will notate having mastered the art corresponding to the lead suit.  During the game, points are awarded for mastering the different arts in the different stages.

Once the players have collectively fully mastered two arts, the game ends and the player with the most points wins.

Name: TRAILS: Promo Pack 1
Description:
Available during the pre-order of Parks: Wildlife expansion or at GenCon booth.

A set of 3 additional badges (1 each in rock, acorn, and leaf badge type), for use with TRAILS base game.

Upgrade your Trails experience with three new Keymaster Exclusive badges - Expand, Expedition, and Exposure!

Name: Boarding Pass
Description:
Weather-wise it's such a lovely day!

The vacation of your dreams is about to start. Jump on your plane and fly over majestic mountains, lush fields, sparkling oceans and magnificent cities to explore all your destination country. Discover exceptional landmarks and collect miles, but do it efficiently before your journey ends.

What are you waiting for? Pack-up and get your Boarding Pass.

Players randomly collect a boarding pass card describing the landscape they need to fly over with their plane to earn points. Starting from their base airport, players will try to create a suitable flying route collecting landscape cards from the compass board and placing them on their own flight path accordingly to the cardinal point they collected that card from.

—description from the designer

Name: Paupers' Ladder: This Cobbled Isle
Description:
“Along with the hustle and bustle of my home, I finally realise the greatest adventures to be had were here beneath my feet all along.”

This Cobbled Isle adds a City Region deck to Paupers’ Ladder and The Moon Towers, so now you can explore Brighthelm’s colourful streets. Then there’s The Cutty Wren, a merchant ship that sails the coast buying and selling exotic wares.

There are also Dice Dens, Special Quests, more Birds, Curses and Talents, and 2 new game modes:

THE TIMELY PAUPER
Play a shorter game for fewer Virtues.

WE, THE COLLECTIVE
A co-operative game. Can you learn your Virtues together before Brighthelm falls?

Name: Unfold Kids: Lollipop Inc.
Description:
Alex and Alice, kids with superpowers, notice that their friends have become unbearable and are acting oddly. And that’s right after the superpopular amusement park “Lollipop Inc.” opened in their city. So, when their secret agent parents are given the task to infiltrate the park, the kids are certain to catch the opportunity of conducting their own investigation…

Lollipop Inc. is an exciting tabletop quest created especially for kids. Open new locations and complete the mission by solving original puzzles, sometimes by completely unconventional means. Find the villain and uncover his evil plans in this standalone Unfold Kids game.

—description from the publisher

Name: SOKO Unvergessen: Fall 1 – Emilia Horvath
Description:
Join Inspector Karl Klugmann's team and investigates the murder of the young student Emilia Horvath in the first criminal case of SOKO Unforgotten
Who has a motive, who has an alibi? Use the police portal P.I.C.A. to question suspects, write e-mails and make phone calls or look up vehicle registrations
Research on the Internet, solve puzzles and draw conclusions from new and old findings. But remember - there are many ways to solve the case and your approach will affect which new clues you receive...
For a full gaming experience you need internet access on a laptop, pad or smartphone
No mandatory entry of personal data required
1 to 6 players: inner from 16+
approx. 2 to 3 hours playing time

Suitable for the deaf
NOTE: The game is designed to respond to player actions and trigger individual actions. 
This means the game can only be played once.

Name: The Heron in Flight
Description:
The Heron In Flight explores the German operation, “Fischreiher” (Heron) to take Stalingrad off the march during the period of mid-August up until mid-September 1942. Failure to encircle Soviet forces west of Stalingrad ensures that an urban brawl for the city will ensue. Both sides are challenged to meet different objectives.

The Germans must utilize their Sixth Army to destroy the three Soviet armies in the land bridge between the Don and the Volga before they can fall back into Stalingrad. Historically, this attack was coordinated with operations by the Fourth Panzer Army that attacked from the southwest and which was to form the southern arm of a gigantic pincer. Supporting the attack are aircraft of the Fourth Air Fleet which ruled the air.

The Soviet player must not only ensure sufficient forces escape the intended German encirclement, but maintain constant pressure on the overextended Sixth Army with a series of counterattacks from north of Stalingrad to relieve pressure on the defenders of the city. The Soviets are also tasked to retain bridgeheads on the Don which will be their key for future operations.

Designed by Mark Stille, this game includes 1 and ½ maps with 420 counters. Units are at the division/brigade level for the Soviets while German and Axis Allied forces are depicted from battalion to division. Each turn is two days.

The game system is based on his earlier Wintergewitter design and emphasizes the effect of air power and a command and control system which makes players plan ahead to conduct operations and carefully weigh where their offensive efforts will be expended.

Maps - One and 1/2 full color 22"x34" hex mapsheets
Counters - 420 standard 1/2" die-cut pieces
Rules length - 14 pages
Charts and tables - 2 pages
Complexity - Medium
Playing time - Up to 4 hours
How challenging is it solitaire? - Average

—description from the publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: desConfronto
Description:
Everternal is a world of fantasy, adventures and dangers.

In the year 1420 C.E. (post Calamity) the legendary mage Pharanor, wielding the mighty Soul Stone, decides to face a recent mysterious threat that has been taking over and corrupting the creatures and lands of Everternal: the Darkness.
