As the last member of the arcane protectors, the Magi Council, whom swear to protect the world after the end of the Calamity, Pharanor gather 3 mighty heroes from all around the world with the hope they could aid him on his journey.

The old mage summons the heroes to his tower, in the Bright Citadel of Kalahad, so together they can follow and seek the path of ruin which Darkness leaves behind to discover the source of the evil that threatens the Everternal.

desConfronto is a 1 - 5 players "LCG" Cardgame where you take on the role of 1 of the 4 most iconic D&D classes.

Each class has an asymmetric deck of action cards (attack, defense, draw, extra action, and “signature” moves), which the player will play with to perform powerful attacks and combos by rolling dices in order to purify de corrupted creatures and animals corrupted by the mysterious Darkness that plagues the world of Everternal.

In a thrilling campaign where players advance from level to level, defeating creatures and collecting the shards of corrupted Soulstones in order to use it to buy new skills, potions and traps, our heroes reach the source of corruption to face the great evil that is threatening the world.

—description from the publisher

Name: Unter Schock
Description:
A wild night. A dead writer. And Mrs Schmidt's talkative parrot. So what happened?
The players are the first on the scene of a mysterious crime. They have to find out what happened and different pieces of evidence to reconstruct the course of events and find the murderer. Three exciting cases are waiting to be solved.

Name: Partners In Crime
Description:
Find your partner in crime without blowing your cover. Your mission is to identify each other by drawing or by writing a single word.

You want your partner to guess who you are, and you will play the detective to work out who else is a partner - but you don't want to be sussed yourself. How subtle can you make your drawing?

The only frustration in this funny game is how hard it is to keep your cover hidden! The rule is easy - don't risk giving the game away by drawing something too obvious.

A game for adults and teens alike, this is a great party game, the best activity for a birthday, hen, stag, house party or any other celebration occasion.

The pack includes 128 cards, 8 scoring boards, 8 drawing boards and 8 washable marker pens. We also include a timer, just to pile on the pressure!

—description from the publisher

Name: Hool!
Description:
Hool! is a traditional Korean rummy game also known as Hoola. You can play with a traditional deck of playing cards, with the cards ordered A23... up to ...JQKA23... so that they loop. Each player starts a round with seven cards in hand and one card face up to start a discard pile.

On a turn, the active player must draw the top card of the deck or the discard pile, but they can draw the latter only if that card will be part of a new meld. After drawing, they can meld a set or sequence of three cards. If this player has a meld in front of them, whether from this turn or an earlier one, they can add to melds already on the table, adding a fourth 6 to a set of three or adding a 2 to a QKA sequence. Additionally, you can meld a 7 on its own to the table.

To end your turn, if you still have cards in hand, discard a card. If you now have no cards in hand, the round ends. Players are then ranked by their points still in hand, with an unplayed 7 being worth 14 points, and players give points to the winner based on their ranking. The worse your rank, the more you pay. Additional penalties might double what you pay depending on what you have in hand.

Alternatively, if you have melded no cards, you can end the game with a blast by having a point total that is small or large enough based on all seven cards in hand. Also alternatively, if you have at most 10 points in hand at the start of your turn, you can call for the end of the round. If you have the smallest total, you're ranked first, but if anyone has fewer points than you, you're automatically ranked last.

Name: FPI Mystery: Disappearance At Wirth Circus
Description:
Jules Leitzel, the star trapeze artist for the Wirth Family Circus, went missing a few days ago. People are saying she's been kidnapped, but speculation won't cut the mustard... WE NEED ANSWERS!

In the Murder Mystery Case, you'll be trying to crack the cases that the police couldn't or wouldn't- the ones your clients don't want them to. You've been recruited for your powers of deduction and induction, and we expect big things from you.

As one of our solvers, you'll get materials from our Field Agents and try to solve the case based on their notes, interviews, and what they collect from the field. Do you have what it takes to crack the case?!

Play solo or in a groups, discuss every detail, and try to solve the case without using any hints!

Name: Necromunda: Underhive – Orlock Gang Tactics Cards
Description:
This set contains 26 cards or use in Necromunda games.

Inside you will find:

18 House Orlock Gang Tactics cards and 8 blank Fighter cards, each proudly stamped with the logo of House Orlock - the House of Iron - ideal for marking out Champions and Leaders in your gang deck!

You will need a copy of the Necromunda Rulebook and Necromunda: House of Iron to use the contents of this pack.

These cards are not the same as the Orlock Gang Cards and Orlock Vehicle cards.  They are a bit different.

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Ruinous Nightmares Pack #1 – Nightmares From Beyond Game Supplement
Description:
There are things in the dark places of the world that are best left unseen by the prying eyes of man. Some horrors that cannot be fathomed. These are the nightmares from beyond, that haunt the deepest shadows, and feed on the fragile minds of those foolish enough to  seek them out.

This 15 card Challenge Supplement adds an all new deck of Ruinous Nightmares to Shadows of Brimstone, allowing players to increase the difficulty of the Adventures. Choose from Nightmare Level 1, 2, or 3 to give your Heroes a serious run for their money. There are some extra rewards for exploring the more dangerous parts of this world though, and Heroes may find that if they can overcome the challenge, glory and riches await. But be warned, Ruinous Nightmares are not for the faint of heart. You have been warned.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Heroic Defenders Game Supplement
Description:
Though the night is dark and full of terrors, there are some brave enough to stand against the Darkness; Heroic Defenders that won't sit idly by and watch their world fall to ruin. When the stakes are highest and the chips are down, these Heroes find a way to dig a little deeper and press on through the horrors arrayed before them.

This 15-card supplement adds an all-new deck of Heroic Effort cards to help give Heroes a fighting chance for survival when the odds are stacked against them. Ideal for low-level Heroes, Hero Parties of only 1-2 Heroes, or to help out new Heroes joining an existing party, Heroic Efforts are one-use special ability cards that give Heroes a boost with a fun story moment when they need it most. With two ways to integrate these cards into your adventures, using Up Against the World or Struggle for Survival, Heroic Efforts give Heroes a fighting chance (especially when paired with the dangerous Ruinous Nightmare cards in the Nightmares From Beyond Supplement).

-description from the publisher's website

Name: SundayQuest Adventures: Volume 2
Description:
This small print expansion pack includes 12 Quests that were originally released on he Ye Olde Inn's companion Facebook group.

It continues where Wizards of Morcar left off.  It is assumed that players will have completed and be familiar with Kellar's Keep, Return of the Witch Lord, Against the Ogre Horde and Wizards of Morcar expansion packs to the original game.  On occasion the Quests will also dabble with elements taken from the U.S. version of the game system's two additional expansion packs: The Mage in the Mirror and the Frozen Horror.

Name: SundayQuest Adventures: Volume 1
Description:
This expansion pack includes 12 Quests that were originally, and exclusively, released on the Ye Olde Inn's companion Facebook group.

Sunday Quest: Adventures continues where the popular Hero Quest expansion Wizards of Morcar left off. It is assumed that players will have completed and be familiar with Kellar's Keep, Return of the Witch Lord, Against the Ogre Horde and Wizards of Morcar expansion packs. On occasion the Quests herein will also dabble with elements taken from the U.S. version of the game system's two additional expansion packs: The Mage in the Mirror and The Frozen Horror.

SundayQuest: Adventures; Volume 1 has been designed to fit in with the original UK release of Hero Quest in the late 1980s. It should be compatible with either the original European or U.S. releases of HeroQuest (1989-1991). It can also be played with the more recent re-release of Hero Quest (2021).
